content:
Posted: March 14
												Great graphics, not a bad game but the 22 gig download is pretty♥♥♥♥♥♥poor when you only get 3 tracks and 1 car with EVERYTHING ELSE is pay to play including tracks. Pretty dissappointing when every other game allows you to unlock basic vehicles and tracks as you progress with premium packages offering higher end vehicles normally unavailable to people not willing to pay. This limits the players who have bought premium packages/vehicles to competition by others and limiting the field of play yet again by putting paid players at a dissadvantage. Finally, if you have the couple of hundred dollars to unlock all vehicles and tracks  then you might be finding yourself playing the game with one or 2 others like Bill Gates who can actually afford to play. Good luck with the game guys but not for me when EVERYTHING comes at a cost. Yes I know you can test drive vehicles before you buy them but once again these are ONLY test drives, all up I give the game a thumbs up for graphics but a BIG THUMBS DOWN for the download size and lack of content. Obviously a game for the elite in society , good luck guys but this is one game that is GONE from my steam account as stated above. All up this game sux HARD CORE for content and playability.

content:
Posted: February 24, 2015
												I played in the "Get Real" physics mode. There wasn't anything close to actual physics involved. It felt like I was driving on black ice. I would let off the gas, brake, and only then turn in and the car would still slide like I was driving on a frozen lake. You can't tell when the car locks back up with its traction either. Save yourself the hassle and get Grid Autosport instead.Update: A few other things that are wrong with this game and make it not enjoyable to play. 1) The distance markers are impossible to see on a normal sized monitor because they put them on the fence instead of track side. Since this game is made by people who sell racing seat/TV setups, I almost think they did this on purpose to sell more TVs.2) The car selection is horrible by any standard even when you buy all the DLC.3) The UI in the game outside of the actual racing is absolute rubbish4) The sound engineers spent a ton of time on the engine sounds and nothing else. 5) The car damage simulation is non-existant. Might as well play bumper cars all day long because nothing will happen to your car.

number of helpful: 2 of 8 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 3, 2015
												Here are the reasons I don’t recommend this game.1. you better have a wheel or a Xbox remote, as the mouse and keyboard configurations are frustrating and useless, which brings us to point 2...2. You don’t have ABS/assisted steering options, so even of you did have an Xbox remote you would still be spinning out all over the place, the system in the game that prevents you from spinning the tires makes the engine sputter and surge and it sounds GOD AWFUL! Ruins the experience!3. 99 percent of the games content needs to be purchased, which is fine. For one the game is perfectly playable with the content they give you and two you wont want to buy any of the content anyway... because the game would be uninstalling by then.4. Forza Motorsports. That’s right; Forza! Why play this when we have Forza??? :-/2 out of 5 stars for "Race Doom". 2 stars for the attention to detail, ruined by pathetic game play.Got the itch to race cars? Go get Forza4... Or Forza Horizon... or Forza5... (or Forza6 for the now much older people that actuly dug and found this review...)

content:
Posted: February 19, 2016
												This game is a very sad disappointment, for what everything in the game costs I would expect more refinement. If you just want something to do for free for a few minutes this will work however there are some serious flaws. The braking is hardly responsive on anything but a calibrated resistance pedal, the noise is unbearable and I dont know how to explain it other than it always sounds like you have a flat tire, I assume this is supposed to be some kind of wind noise or something but I didnt spend a ton of time trying to identify it. Crashes are possibly the most annoying thing as if you barely bump another car you end up flipping end over end right off the track. Save yourself the download time on this one.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												First off, Simbin games have been my absolute favorite since I found GT Legends. So I really, realllly wanted to love this game. So I gave it a chance. Pros: Stunning soundLots of great cars... for a priceLots of great tracks... for a priceYou can customize your game with the content you chooseCons: It's free-to-play, and it reminds you of that fact every 10 seconds. My computer has an i7 Devil's Canyon, 16 gigs of G.Skill Sniper RAM, and an SSD. It still takes forever to load, because, guess what, it's connecting to the master server to find what advertisements to load. Great visuals if you've been in a coma since 1999. The UI is as user-friendly as something from the era of Tiger hand-held games. Seriously, the game's worst enemy is the game itself. And that is what is keeping this from being a classic SimBin title. TL;DR Pass on this and buy Assetto Corsa

content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												**This game is Garbage... Be warned, before you can play this game you HAVE to make an account via email**I am by no means a professional car sim driver/racer but I understand the basics when it comes to tuning and driving a car for track or drift. I also only play driving games in manual and not automatic. I have played other driving games such as Forza Motorsport 4 (Xbox 360) and Grand Turismo 4 (Playstation 2).For a FREE game despite it's mixed reviews, I decided to go in to this game open-minded and give it a shot. I setup all the controls before attempting to run a "Qualifying Race", just to test how the cars would drive before I would play online. I never made it online... I understand that the car given too much throttle can make it spin out, but this was beyond REDICULOUS!!!! It was nearly impossible to keep the cars from spinning out. I tried this game with both keyboard and mouse but I perfer an xbox controller. Maybe that is why the cars did no perform so well, because I do not have a steering wheel and pedal setup. I won't neglect to mention that I only played this game for about 25 minutes but this game just didn't feel like it was worth my time. I'll stick to paid for driving sims from now on.

content:
Posted: November 20, 2015
												the gameplay is ok, except it follows no racing rules what so ever, in a race i dont think some♥♥♥♥♥hole is going to ram you and smash you constantly like a b!tch. you have to pay to play the full experience, its free to download but you have to pay to have fun. the trailer and videos of this game is misleading, not showing the true graphics and sounds of the cars itself, its a lot worse. this game is useless. get something like Kerbal space program, just something that wont waste your time.this game will.EDIT: after a while, I can see I judged the game too hard, the game's concept is OK, but not flawless. but there are still a lot more problems with this abomination on Steam, hopefully SimBin sees this and improves1) Do you want to buy cars? Say no more, pay $4.99 for ONE car!2) what's that? you don't want to pay money? there is ingame currency to use in buying cars.now here is the problem with 2: the only way to actually GET Vrp (ingame currency) you need to pay real money for DTM Experience. you need DTM experience to ACTUALLY EARN VRP!JUST GREAT, so you are stuck with two race tracks (3 if you include the hillclimb)  and very few cars to drive.3) No ThrustMaster T80 support, as soon as I lightly press my foot on the pedal, R3E assumes it is on full throttle, flooring the pedal has no difference to lightly tapping my pedals, this is not an issue with the wheel itself, Gran Turismo 6 works fine.

content:
Posted: June 10, 2015
												Sort of a mixed bag of good and bad.Overall the game is good honestly, but it isn't a game you can just plug in your controller and enjoy.You really have to tweak the settings, I couldn't get it ever to be just right. Either its not sensitive enough and i can't turn as well as I'd like too or its too sensitive and I turn and spin out.I wanted to like this game so bad, but I can't find any recommended settings for a Xbox Controller... so until then I will have to uninstall.But if you can spend 2-3 hours messing around with the controls to fit just the way you like it then this game could be up your alley. Just know this game isn't plug and play, like literally I plugged in my controller and the car wouldn't move cause I didn't set up the controller to any keybinds in the game.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2015
												Firstly, the claim that it is "free", It Is free to download and to run.You get 3 cars or so and a couple of tracks, then you HAVE to spend MONEY.So, no it is NOT free, more of a "DEMO" of the game...OK get past that... IS it a sim, Well you CAN adjust the seats,mirrors etc.You also have a HUGE choice of sound options, but how do you adjust the "CAR" setup?Short answer is you can't. Not suspention, Not brakes or tyres. Infact playing "Single player" Icould find NO meaningful car adjustments at all.. So it is NOT really a sim...SO what the hell is it? It is a fairly good raceing game, Do i enjoy playing it?Yes i do, to the point of spending some cash to get the DTM "classic" pack & the 2013 DTM season.The cars are good, drive well but still no ability to customize car setup for your own driveing style..SO in summary :1  It is NOT free to play, Be prepared to spend a lot of $ if you want ALL the content...2  It is NOT a SIM. If you are looking for a cool game this might be it. If you are lookingfor a HARDCORE "racing sim" Keep looking, this isnt it..

content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												Updated review 07/24/2016:Doesn't seem to support RX 480 video cards from AMD. I'm sure it's a driver thing, but how long has this game been out now? It will detect something like an Xbox One controller for Windows, but you have to manually go in and assign every button to a function yourself. Really? That's just lazy developers.

content:
Posted: May 16, 2015
												My advice, get a steering wheel before you jump into this, because if you have a gamepad, or if you're playing using a mouse and keyboard, you're gonna have a bad time.Controls aside, even though the game is free to play, everything (save three cars and three tracks) MUST be purchased to access, which will set you back about €100, which unless you're willing to pay for it, will significantly lower the replay value.From my experience, I wouldn't recommend this, but instead would encourage you to look into other racing simulators like Project CARS or Assetto Corsa if you want a definitive sim racing experience.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 9
												This game was absolute garbage when it originally launched. Broken menus, poor performance, a lack of content, you name it. Unfortunately Early Access did not exist at the time, otherwise that would have been a better way to advertise the pre-release state that it officially launched in.Fast forward a few years, and I hear it's received a lot of updates. Maybe time to try it again? So, I reinstall it, try to login, and... my email address is already registered. After a lot of back and forth in the game and on their website, I'm completely unable to login, even though I've previously had an account and played the game. Forums are no help and, unfortunately, there's no method to even "recover" an account. So I'm directed to the "RaceRoom help desk" which asks me for a password over HTTP instead of HTTPS. This is 2017. That was the last straw.This company's software remains garbage. No thanks.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 12, 2015
												Looks and sounds great the biggest con is that its a game and not a movie. Playing on any difficulty is going to have some massive draw back on novice the game practically does everything for you and what you can do is controlled and unresponsive. On amateur things respond half way decently but the physics seem un realistic turning is an option that they decided shouldn't be a priority and if you need to reverse your just going to drive straight backwards or slide every where because again turning was deemed unneccesary. If you even think about playing on the get real setting your going to have a bad time. The get real setting is the most ridiculous least realistic of all the settings. You will slide uncontrollably in first gear attempting to go in a straight line and most likely get so frustrated that you will quit the game before you make it around one lap. The gameplay is mildly improved if using a controller but not to the point that it becomes fun. The game is also very pay to play there is so little content that is free that even if you can get past just how♥♥♥♥♥♥the game itself is that you willl eventually just stop playing from sheer boredom.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2014
												For a free game, this game is actually somehwat decent... until you take into account the half-done world, car and track detail and the horrendus keyboard controls. It is nearly impossible to control your car with a keyboard, so you practically already need to buy a controller just to play the damn thing! Also, this game is a total play to win. You literally only get two cars and 2 tracks. The rest you have to buy with real money. And without the feature to race multiplayer, there's really no point to playing singleplayer. The only part this game shines is the challenge/time trial mode, where every week there's a different car and track that you need to set your best time with, and beat out other people in the world who are also trying to set the fastests time. It was fun to even try to compare your terrible lap time you did on a keyboard that was 30 seconds behind a 1:44. That however, is literally the only thing that kept me playing for hours on end. The only damn thing. Otherwise, until the develepors atleast stop trying to milk every last cent out of you, DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME LIKE I DID WITH THIS GAME.

content:
Posted: July 12, 2016
												I've reviewed this game before but I judged it unfairly since I went off of previous versions that just flat out didn't work. So let me tell you about THIS version that I played not five minutes ago...Are there bugs?-Many (one I can point out is the fact that I tried a "hill climb" race, and no matter what I ALWAYS got a "false start")Is it optimized?-Not at all (when driving in a straight line I got about 60 FPS, but try to turn one degree to the left and the turning animations nearly freeze the game until my computer figured out how to handle it)Are there "in-game transactions"?-Well, that's a fun question... You CAN buy stuff whenever you want with real world money, but it's not a requirement. You can solely base your game around "grinding" for cash in single player like Gran Turismo or Need For Speed, which brings us to our next point.Is this like Gran Tursimo or Need For Speed?-This is another hard question to answer since, even though all of them are enclosed racing games by now, this is almost completely different... The physics are wacky (your car can spin out at random), the camera is just awful (you use V and N to look from left to right in your car, and it's not even smooth, no, it instantly looks to a predefined position), and half the time where you shouldn't get a "false start", you do anyway... Whereas with those games, they have, decent physics, the camera moves WITH the car, and false starts are a bit rare...In conclusion, I honestly hated the game. Go ahead and try it, I mean it is free, but be warned, if you like realistic racing games, this might not be the best choice...

number of helpful: 1 of 8 people (13%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 15, 2014
												Overall this Game is halfway decent in Singleplayer Mode. It offers a wide variety of Cars and Tracks to choose from and allows the Player to run on more arcade-ish Amateur or more realistic Simulation Settings. Multiplayer on the other hand is a huge disappointment, as there are no Private Lobbies and all the Servers are pre-defined without any Options to modify Track Conditions, Realism Settings or other very important things.Pricing of DLC Vehicles is ridiculous and even though they look decent in the game.. they don't seem to be too different from one another regarding Driving and Crash Physics.I honestly would not recommend this Game to anyone.Get off the Free 2 Play Train and create another Retail Title, which offers a Complete Package and does not force the Player to be always Online and registered on your Website... it kind of ruined the Immersion for me.4/10

content:
Posted: May 11, 2016
												Spent all 26 minutes I have dicking with my XBone controller. There are apparently officially endorsed profiles, but those aren't offered in game -- they're on the 3rd party website and buried in pages of forums. Ok, whatever, get one or two of those to try out.Every profile has something wacky. Steering wheel will turn right but not left. Steering wheel will stick after turning and never re-center. Gas is bound to trigger but acts digitally rather than analog.Tried with Xbox 360 and Xbone controllers; same results with both. Forums suggest that this game really only works if you buy a high end racing wheel.The game itself looked nice and I've enjoyed a few other racing genre games, but you really have to struggle for a long time to get the controls tuned in this one (if the forums are any indication) and I couldn't ever get a setup on my controller that was even functional. All customizations have to be done outside of game and you have to restart the game over and over to try them.

content:
Posted: April 24, 2016
												So while I was downloading 20 freaking GB I was thinking "It's free and it doesn't have good ratings, but meh, it can't be that bad". Well I was expecting I would be able to EVEN PLAY. I was wrong. I started the game, it auto-configured in 4:3, 800x600 resolution, not being able to set 1080 if you have Super resolution activated. Tried again, and a text appeared on the screen "Controller found with no profile. Create a new one".  "That's good" i though. I was wrong AGAIN. A controller configuration screen appears, and if you can get to click on the option called "Steering left", maybe it lets you change it. So you double click on it and... Wait. Are you seriously asking me to press the button I want to use for steering IN A F*CKING DRIVING WHEEL? Thrust doesn't work. It doesn't even recognize my brake pedal. I start a new race hoping it will magically work. I was wrong for the third time. Nothing worked, the graphic quality was AWFUL even in ultra, extremely unrealistic, and well, the race didn't even start per sé. It just dropped me (literally) on the road in the moment the race started. No lights, no force feedback, no NOTHING.Well at least I learned how to buy Assetto Corsa. 10/10.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2016
												This game tries hard to be a quality racing game, but it falls short. It's like that special needs kid in the back of the class room surrounded by so many extremely gifted students. This game tries extremely hard, but it falls flat on its face.Let's first look at how it looks. It honestly doesn't look bad as no-name racing games tend to go, but it's certainly not winning any awards in the graphics department.The controls are terrible. Extremely unintuitive and not fun. Plus, on my gamepad, there's no degree to the movement. You either crank the steering wheel all the way or not at all.The music is okay, I guess.The sound could be far better and far crisper.If you want to play a good racing game, take a look at Asphalt 8: Airborne. That sucker is a masterpiece on all platforms.

												Being a fan of Simbin's.. sorry "sector 3's" previous games Race O7, GTR, RACE etc, I was excited to see where their new Raceroom series would go. Unfortunately, along with the name change comes a change in their business model also. While Raceroom is free, the selection of tracks and cars are minimal and if your want to race properly you have to pay as you go. Very disappointing. Hence why I've not given this much of a go. Try something with better value like Reiza studios games or rFactor 1 or 2.

												Good immersion, good real photorealistic tracks, good sound, real race series DTM, ADAC and WTCC. Good for time attack. BUT FOR RACE WITH AI - ABSOLUTELY NO!!!  AI - blind blockheads who ride on railway! AI cars remind me blind engine drivers. Really the game developers can not put them eyes? This game is a simulator? Why does AI do not see me and hit from behind and to the side when I find myself on their way? This makes the game ABSOLUTELY NOT PLAYABLE!!!
